raw_comment:
I notice that the money income your family has, the more likely you are to be accepted into that college, which is not okay because if you're a student who is of the middle to lower class and you're trying really hard, and dont make it because of your income does everyone still have equal opportunity to education? 
I wonder why students who are more finacially stable have higher chances of accessing that higher education.
In my community, this relates because we are applying to colleges right now.
"Is education really fair?"
ace_sentences: A family has a money income.
If a family has a higher money income then a student from this family is more likely to be accepted into a college.
A student can be middle-class or lower-class.
A student can try very hard.
A student can fail to be accepted into a college because of the money income of the family.
I ask whether everyone has equal opportunity to education.
If a student is financially stable then this student has a higher chance of accessing higher education.
I wonder why this is the case.
In my community, we are applying to colleges now.
The question is: Is education really fair?
